text: Python: Reading part of a text file
I'm new to python and programming.
I need to read in chunks of a large text file, format looks like the following:

code: <word id="8" form="hibernis" lemma="hibernus1" postag="n-p---nb-" head-"7" relation="ADV"/>

text: I need the form, lemma and postag information.
for above I need hibernis, hibernus1 and n-p---nb-.
How do I tell python to read until it reaches form, to read forward until it reaches the quote mark " and then read the information between the quote marks "hibernis"?
My attempts so far have been to remove the punctuation, split the sentence and then pull the info I need from a list.
Having trouble getting python to iterate over whole file though, I can only get this working for 1 line.

code:
f=open('blank.txt','r')
quotes=f.read()
noquotes=quotes.replace('"','')
f.close()

rf=open('blank.txt','w')
rf.write(noquotes)
rf.close()   

f=open('blank.txt','r')
finished = False
postag=[]
while not finished:
   line=f.readline()
   words=line.split()
   postag.append(words[4])
   postag.append(words[6])
   postag.append(words[8])              
   finished=True
